org.midica.ui.model

Class MidicaTreeNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode
      • org.midica.ui.model.MidicaTreeNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, javax.swing.tree.MutableTreeNode, javax.swing.tree.TreeNode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MessageTreeNode

    public class MidicaTreeNode
extends javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode

    This class represents a node for a MidicaTree.

    It contains a name, a descendant counter and a number representing a MIDI byte, double byte or byte range. However the number can be null.

    This class is designed to be used mainly from a MidicaTreeModel. The following steps are necessary:

    • Call one of the constructors.
    • Call initChildren(), if it’s a branch. Not necessary for leafs.
    • For each child:
    • Call addAndOrIncrement(String, String, String, boolean)
    • Call increment()
    • After all children are added, connect them with each other in the right order by calling addChildren(). This works recursively.
    Author:
    Jan Trukenm√ºller

        Parameters:
        name - Main text to be displayed.

      • MidicaTreeNode

        public MidicaTreeNode()

        Creates a new node with an empty name.

        This constructor is used indirectly from the MidicaTreeModel and from this class (MidicaTreeNode) by calling newInstance() on the class object. So the node name or number must be set later with setName(String) or setNumber(String).

    • Method Detail

      • increment

        public void increment()

        Increments the count by 1. This is called if a descendant of this node is added to the tree.

      • initChildren

        public void initChildren()

        Initializes the data structure for the sorted children.

      • addAndOrIncrement

        public MidicaTreeNode addAndOrIncrement(java.lang.String id,
                                        java.lang.String name,
                                        java.lang.String number,
                                        boolean isLeaf)
                                 throws java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException

        Creates and/or increments the specified child.

        If a new child is created, it is also added to the sorted children data structure. However it is not yet added to the tree.

        Parameters:
        id - Child identifier string – unique for the children of this node.
        name - Child name.
        number - MIDI number representation of the child.
        isLeaf - Specifies if the child is a leaf or a branch.
        Returns:
        created or incremented child.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException - if the new child node cannot be created.

      • addChildren

        public void addChildren()

        Adds all children recursively.

      • getToolTip

        public java.lang.String getToolTip()

        Returns the same string that’s also displayed as the node.

        Can be overridden in order to return a more customized tooltip.

        Returns:
        the tooltip to be displayed.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()

        Returns the string to be displayed in the tree.

        toString in class javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode
